A3. ‘Mexico, long the king of the low-cost plants and exporter to the United States . . . is fast being supplanted by China and its hundreds of millions of low wage workers . . . In all, 500 of Mexico’s 3,700 maquiladoras have shut down since 2001, at a cost of 218,000 jobs, the Mexican government says.’ Recent reports suggest that maquila employment has been recovering as industries have become more efficient and more flexible, able to use proximity to the US to ensure a steady flow of deliveries that permits retailers to minimize inventories
